thread.title: Police: Toddler in car during heroin buy - New Hampshire news
thread.title_full: Police: Toddler in car during heroin buy - New Hampshire news

author: boston.com
title: Police: Toddler in car during heroin buy - New Hampshire news
text:
Three New Hampshire adults were arrested and charged with child endangerment and possession on Wednesday after police said they brought a three-year-old girl on a trip to purchase heroin, The Eagle-Tribune reports .
The police report, according to The Eagle-Tribune , says Jennifer Kubacki, 31, entered and quickly left a home in Lawrence, and then returned to her car. She and two other adults — Leah Storey, 41 and Scott Senecal, 43, — then drove away from the area with their heads looking at their laps.
Detectives noticed a toddler in a booster seat behind the passenger seat, and they then moved to pull the car over, police said. The car contained items that appeared to be drug paraphernalia and heroin, according to The Eagle-Tribune . Police said Kubacki was the mother of the girl.
 Read the rest of The Eagle-Tribune story here .
